intro: Tonestus eximius, commonly known as the noble spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often clustered in complex inflorescences. The leaves are usually alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture.
